event: After a period in private legal practice, John Kerry was elected Lieutenant Governor of Massachusetts in 1982.
In 1984, John Kerry was elected to the United States Senate.

John Kerry was reelected to additional terms in 1990, 1996, 2002 and John Kerry won the Democratic Party presidential nomination in 2004, alongside vice presidential nominee and North Carolina Senator John Edwards.

John Kerry remained in the United States Senate and chaired the Senate Committee on Foreign Relations from 2009 to 2013.In January 2013, John Kerry was nominated by Barack Obama to succeed Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, and was confirmed by John Kerry's Senate colleagues on a vote of 94 to 3.
John Kerry was born on December 11, 1943, at Fitzsimons Army Medical Center in Aurora, Colorado.
In 1960, while at St. Paul's School in Concord, New Hampshire's, John Kerry played bass in a minor rock band called The Electras with six of John Kerry's classmates.
In March 1965, as the Vietnam War escalated, John Kerry won the Ten Eyck prize as the best orator in the junior class for a speech that was critical of U.S. foreign policy.
John Kerry began John Kerry's active duty military service on August 19, 1966.
After completing 16 weeks of Officer Candidate School at the U.S. Naval Training Center in Newport, Rhode Island, John Kerry received John Kerry's officer's commission on December 16, 1966.
Eight days later, on February 28, 1969, came the events for which John Kerry was awarded John Kerry's Silver Star Medal.
On January 1, 1970, John Kerry was temporarily promoted to full lieutenant.
John Kerry was on active duty in Navy from August 1966 until January 1970.

With the continuing controversy that had surrounded the military service of John Kerry since the 2000 presidential election (when John Kerry was accused of having used John Kerry's father's political influence to gain entrance to the Texas Air National Guard, thereby protecting John Kerry from conscription into the United States Army, and possible service in the Vietnam War), John Kerry's contrasting status as a decorated the Vietnam War veteran posed a problem for John Kerry's re-election campaign, which Republicans sought to counter by calling Kerry's war record into question.

The remaining 10,891 votes were split amongst the other five candidates, with 1970 nominee Richard Williams coming last with just 1,706 votes (2.26%).In the Democratic primary race, John Kerry was initially favored to defeat the Republican candidate, former State Representative Paul W. Cronin, and conservative Democrat Roger P. Durkin, who ran as an Independent.
John Kerry won re-election with 52 percent to Governor William Weld, a popular Republican incumbent who had been re-elected in 1994 with 71% of the vote's 45 percent.
John Kerry supported the North American Free Trade Agreement and Most Favored Nation status for China, but opposed the Central American Free Trade Agreement.[citation needed]In July 1997
John Kerry chaired the Senate Select Committee on POW/MIA Affairs from 1991 to 1993.
John Kerry was reelected to Senate in 1990, 1996 (after winning re-election against the then-Governor of Massachusetts Republican William Weld), 2002, and 2008.

As a role model for campus leaders across the nation and strong advocate for global development, John Kerry was honored by the Millennium Campus Network (MCN) as a Global Generation Award winner in 2011.
On July 6, 2004, John Kerry announced John Kerry's selection of Sen. John Edwards (D-North Carolina) as John Kerry's running mate.
During John Kerry's bid to be elected president in 2004, John Kerry frequently criticized incumbent George W. Bush for starting the Iraq War.
John Kerry's brother had said such a campaign was "conceivable", and John Kerry reportedly said at a farewell party for John Kerry's 2004 campaign staff, "There's always another four years".[0

John Kerry was sworn in as Secretary of State on February 1, 2013.While serving as the Secretary of State, John Kerry spoke in the French language on several occasions in John Kerry's official capacity.
John Kerry did not attend Donald Trump's's inauguration on January 20, 2017, and the following day took part in the 2017 Women's March in Washington, D.C.Kerry
John Kerry said the discussion was to include the fossil fuel industry, adding that the fossil fuel industry's targets set for 2050 were not sufficient.

event: Kerry's Jewish ancestry was publicly revealed during John Kerry's 2004 presidential campaign; John Kerry has stated that John Kerry was unaware of Kerry's Jewish ancestry until a reporter informed John Kerry of Kerry's Jewish ancestry in John Kerry's maternal ancestors were of Scottish and English descent, and John Kerry's maternal grandparents were James Grant Forbes II of the Forbes family and Margaret Tyndal Winthrop of the Dudley–Winthrop family.

John Kerry was married to Julia Thorne in 1970, and they had two daughters together: documentary filmmaker Alexandra Kerry (born September 5, 1973) and physician Vanessa Kerry (born December 31, 1976).Alexandra
